trans-unit.source: The SortKey class stores sort criteria for use by sort controls.
The SortKey constructor creates and initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey"></xref> class.

The SortKey constructor creates and initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey"></xref> class using the specified attribute name, matching rule, and sort order.
The name of the attribute to use as a sort key.
The object identifier (OID) of the matching rule for the sort.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the sort is ordered from the lowest to highest or <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the sort order is from highest to lowest.
The AttributeName property specifies the name of the attribute to use as a sort key.
The name of the attribute to use as a sort key.
The MatchingRule property specifies the object identifier (OID) of the matching rule for the sort.
The OID of the matching rule for the sort.
The ReverseOrder property specifies if the sort should be returned in reverse order.

This property is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the sort is ordered from the lowest to highest or <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the sort is ordered from highest to lowest.
